scenes.location: 8TH STREET BETWEEN AVENUES C AND D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of dark-skinned girls wearing cheerleading outfit align themselves in formation on the sidewalk. They begin dance. No music can be heard. The sound of the girls' bod is our soundtrack. We hear their strained breathing, palm and sneaker bottoms pounding while they hum and count sof to themselves in an effort to keep the rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO: We explore the bodies of the dancers; their brigh eyes and sweaty brows, their stomping feet and colliding  hands (dark side and light side). The younger girls perfo provocative dance movements, the older girls repeat them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bodies silhouette in the bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMANDA, a tall 14-year-old exits the front door of her  apartment budding with her headphones in one hand and a  magazine in the other. She sits down on her stoop, puts h headphones on and presses "play". We can hear the sound o Salsa leaking out of the sides of her headphones. JENETTE ten years old with big black hair in rubber-band restrain the sidewalk below Amanda drawing with a piece of chalk. looks over her shoulder and sees Amanda reading her magaz climbs the stairs and sits down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans to reveal AARON, an 18-year-old boy on th other side of the street, unloading some fireworks from t trunk of a car. He's filling a paper bag with them,  carefully making sure not to reveal what he's doing to  onlookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the ear end of the block, DONNA, 14, and MICHELLE, 12, sit and watch Aaron at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he look up close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Amorously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, he got dark brownish  eyes, he got a nice nose I  love his nose. I love his  skin. I love his lips, he  got a great smile and he  got-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he got a bad  attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said before, that he  got boxes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO: The camera is very close to Aaron. Details of his body in a shallow depth of field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he got boxes in his  stomach. He's taller than  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's 18 or 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Amanda's stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With a sigh of negative attitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR, a mature-looking 13-year old is crossing the  street. He enters frame with Amanda and Jenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, wuzzup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Hector

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Amanda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're not gonna say  hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMANDA'S POV: Donna approaches Aaron as he locks up the  trunk of the car. She hesitantly calls over to him. He  acknowledges her with a lift of the chin. Making sure he  keeps his distance from her, he looks around to see if  anyone is watching him. He tosses his head for her to  follow. He begins to walk away down the block. She follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is looking at Amanda. He appears to have run out o things to say. Amanda removes her headphones. Her music  becomes clearer, more audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, you gonna keep me  hangin' like dat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector, Yo try to rap to me every day, why don't you  take your three-quarters retarded ass outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, you betta give me my  respects or I'll tell your  little girl ova here what  I heard about you and my  boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda puts her headphones back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR looks like he got a new girl anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR, a skinny 12-year-old with sloppy hair, is asleep the sun on his fire escape. There is sweat beaded up on h body. His shirt is rolled up behind his head like a pillo His breath is heavy, his chest rises and falls. The camer tilts to reveal CARLOS, ten, rounding the corner on the  street below. The camera tracks backwards as Carlos  approaches. He is talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha gonna do when ya  bitch is untrue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos lifts his head up to look at the fire escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Victor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans and tilts up to the fire escapes. The  buildings float by. He arrives in front of Victor's  building and cups his hand around his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Victor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the fire escape, Victor's eyes pop open and the sun  shines into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, wuzzup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sits up and looks over the side of the fire escape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got punished, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fa what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let my motha cut  my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fucks it all up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it! C'mon Let's go  to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't man, I'm punished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I'm gonna get  punished more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I always get  into trouble, c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sits down on the fire escape. Carlos pauses for a  minute and turns his back on Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! The girls are  waiting for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor hops back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Tell me which one you would like. To be doin'  nothin on a fire escape or beat the pool with a bunch of  girls? Be straight up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor climbs down the fire escape and hops down to the  street. he immediately grabs Carlos and starts pushing hi down the block to avoid being seen from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys safely round the corner onto Avenue D. Victor  perks up and starts nudging Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what girls are over  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha, Maria, Tina-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the pretty girls  you told me to come down  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sighs and runs his fingers through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference, you  never do anything anyway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor makes a disagreeing gesture. Carlos drags Victor  Downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going that  way for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not goin' to 10th  Street, people piss and  shit in that pool,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, what we gotta  leave ar' own neighborhood  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, if I go down you're  goin' down with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Victor and Carlos hang on each other as they wal Avenue D towards the Pitt Street Pool. They pass by Victo giving him an impromptu smack and then bang on a store wi hello to a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Victor's POV we work our way through a crowd of peop an cross 3rd Street. Victor looks back at the crowd with watchful eye. The camera tracks along in the street as th boys walk along the sidewalk. Victor looks up at a street sign. It reads, "Houston St." As the boys make their way  across the wide intersection, the heat is slightly visibl as car exhaust fills the gridlocked lanes. Victor and  Carlos walk calmly, with space between them, making their way towards the camera in a shallow depth of field as we  follow focus on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Carlos stand on line outside the pool gates. P examine the boys as they slowly inch their way into the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Victor's POV we see the expanse of the pool as he  enters the park. We watch as he surveys the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a high angle we see Carlos nudge Victor to make his  way onto the pool deck. They enter the crowd, proceeding  carefully, making sure not to bump anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue to walk, Victor's POV reveals the bodies of older boys and girls, rough water and mischievous kids

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda is sitting poolside with Jenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that girl, over there?  Hoochie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette looks out across the pool trying to see who Amand is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And him. Stay away from  him, he's only interested  in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda points between Jenette's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos steps in front of them, Amanda smacks his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Amanda, wassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda is Eddie's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie from Compost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Baruch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl swimming in the pool calls over to Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos! Carlos, get your  skinny ass over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay right here, I'll be  right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos walks off leaving Victor standing next to Amanda a Jenette. Victor looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wit' Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda points out across the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Jenette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him right there, That's  who I'm talkin' about.  (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you move, I  can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda spots Aaron and Donna in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda turns to Jenette and continues talking to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, I'm gonna go find  Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Victor turns to walk, the camera pans to follow him,  revealing Hector who is approaching Amanda. The camera th pans back to Amanda. She sighs and turns her ahead away  from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the playground area at the Pitt Street Pool, Aaron is impression of Al Pacino. Darrell and Boy 1 look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Boy 1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna meet my little  friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy 1 is laughing at Aaron. Donna and Michelle stand near watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck wit' me! Don't  fuck wit' me. (pointing his finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lawyer's so good he'll  have you workin in Alaska,  so dress warn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you have an attitude  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, I'm busy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I just wanna speak to  you. I just wanna speak  to you the way I feel  about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, you're wastin'  my time, what the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron turns back to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't scream at me.  I like you, but I don't  like the way your attitude  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So get the fuck outta  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darrell and Boy 1 approve. They wait for Donna's reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go out with you, I  want to be part of your  life. I want you to treat  me the way a girlfriend  should be treated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't go out with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once in your life have  some         respect for me,  don't even curse at me or  nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Darrell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's tellin' me what  the fuck to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you drive me crazy. I  just want you to know how  I feel and you don't          understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the fuck outta  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna stares at Aaron as he turns back to his friends.  Michelle walks up to Donna and gently leads her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl be trippin'.  (Back into his Pacino impression)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time I let her kiss my  rings and forever  she tries to repay me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Carlos are playing, trying to force each other underwater.  Carlos squirts water through his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go take a piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we were at 10th Street  Pool you woulda done it  right in the water, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans as Victor climbs out of the pool and onto long line. As he stands and waits, Amanda can be seen in  the background arguing with Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the water, Carlos makes a face at Victor. Victor makes one back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Under his breath to Carlos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna beat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector and Amanda have been arguing. Jenette is sitting o beneath  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I eave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you share the  wealth a little bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector grabs her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me! I gotta go to  the ladies' room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda gets on line behind Victor as he continues to anta Carlos in the  distance. Amanda recognizes Victor from behind, peeking  over his shoulder at the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor turns around to Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo shorty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda hears something over her shoulder and spins her he around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hector)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!  (To Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I know another  bathroom over there, c'mon  this line's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda takes Victor by the hand and walks towards Hector. She bumps into him with Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda gives Hector a snotty grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags Victor away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a small corner, out of sight to the rest of the kids a Amanda  complains to Victor. Victor looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fucking guy be  followin' me around, and  touchin' me. Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs and pulls on the bathroom door. It's locked. Sh gives it another try. It won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just do me a favor.  Stand right here, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda takes Victor's hand for balance and squats down,  pulling her bathing suit bottoms to the side. She urinate Victor watches her, trying to play it cool. The camera  tilts up from Amanda's face peeking up at Victor, to thei hands straining for balance, to Victor's wandering eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close-up of ERICA looking into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're "Fantasy" and This  is Shai, Diamond-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Melody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the three girls standing in line on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're gonna sing a  song called 'Tell me  What.' It was written by  myself, Diamond and Shai  and the vocals were  arranged by us two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesca rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, it was written May  24th 1998 at 10:20 p.m.  Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls begin to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos stands in front of the singers mocking them. The  camera pans to see Victor approaching Carlos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wussup, Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, can I talk to you for  a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos nods his head. Victor leans into Carlos, resting h arm on Carlos' shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, remember from the  pool, that girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Eddie's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie from Compost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie from Baruch, the one  who was sittin' wit' dat  little girl;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the phat ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, c'mon, stop playin'.  The girl that you kissed  when we got there. Where s he live at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Carlos-I'm gonna punch  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mockingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna punch you. What  you want with her anyway?  You in love with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives near Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she lives down by  Pitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Natasha's? Or over by  Boy's Club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think by Twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want with her  anyway'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor starts walking off down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! What you goin' for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you know what,  you're not supposed to   know but yesterday she  lent me her pills for her  Moms and if I don't give  'em to her she's gonna  die. You want her to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos shrugs Victor off as he walks away down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do when your  bitch is untrue?  You cut the hooker off and  find someone new. I need  another bitch another  bitch in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Victor's trip through the streets in search of A block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna and Michelle are standing in front of their buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, merengue, you do  like this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle places one hand on her side, the other in the ai and begins to step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right, you  got it girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle grabs Donna, they embrace and dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now salsa, you know how to  dance salsa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then dance. Show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna dances. Michelle looks over her shoulder. Aaron is  drinking a bottle of soda across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's  watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron sits on a stoop across the street from Michelle and shaking up  a bottle of soda, then opening the cap to let the bubbles out. He's got a large brown paper bag with him. Victor th corner,  his eyes are scanning across the buildings on the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Shorty, you wanna buy  some M-80s?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four for two  dollars, son, and ain't  talkin' no little pussy  boxes, I'm talkin' big  ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll be here, if  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor continues down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor finds Jenette sitting on Amanda's stoop. She appea just come  outside as she unties a jump rope that is knotted around waist Victor stands next to her for a moment waiting awkw speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette is ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron watches from down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor steps towards Jenette. As he turns to face her, sh is roll her sock down to her ankle and preparing to jump  her rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little girl, you know  a girl named Amanda who  lives around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette stands sloppily in front of him on the street. Sh says nothing and begins to jump. Smic-smac, smic-smac,  smic-smack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? She's got kind  of like brown hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend told me she  lived around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend must be  misinformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I see you at Pitt  yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want with  her anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good friend of hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you're not  lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I know what you're  thinking, that I'm one of  those guys that keep  coming up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.                 (Under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector approaches Victor from down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You here to see somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl named Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's like this high, dark  hair, skinny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, that's my girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't say she had no  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you turn around  and go back to where you  came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor looks over to Jenette. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betta bounce, yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector shoves Victor away from the stoop. Victor steps up Hector. Jenette watches them. interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betta leave the block,  yo, or me and my boys,  we're gonna fuck you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor looks at Hector then walks away down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor rounds the corner and sits down on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck man. I'm gonna get a  fuckin' M-80 and shove it  up his retarded ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTOPHER, an energetic ten-year-old, exits the front d building  holding a bat, sits down on the curb and looks out at the the camera  pans, we see Aaron on the corner talking to Mari. Michell are walking  down the block. Hector is making his way back over to Ama building and  Jenette is jumping rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris rubs his eyes, turns around and looks up at one of  the windows in his building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Up to the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's head sticks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom waves her hand, signaling to him that it's safe to  cross the street. Chris, picking up a half-deflated  football, runs into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris makes his way down the block, stomping along in big High-tops. He spots Aaron a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is sitting on the sidewalk crushing a soda bottle u foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris approaches and tosses the ball to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron stands up and tosses the ball back to Chris, then  lights a cigarette. Chris waits until Aaron is ready and  throws again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too hot, get outta  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle and Donna are sitting on their stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to change. I  want to get to know the  real him and I want him to  get to know the real me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle looks at Donna. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so frustrating. I ask  him if he's mad and he  says no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is still sitting on the sidewalk around the corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! You live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Amanda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods again, smiles and throws the ball at Victor.  Victor catches it and throws it back. Chris catches it an then starts to run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor starts to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up, yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slips through a fence to enter the alleyway and Vic behind him.  A "No Trespassing" sign hangs on the gate. Victor looks a little as they continue their game of catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the boys play, the gate creaks and swings open. The bo quickly scurry into an out-of-the-way corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Donna enter the alleyway. The boys watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, tell me, what'd  you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rumor that you  were tryin' to get  somebody to beat me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What chu listening to  rumors for? I'm not like  dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron puts his bag of fireworks down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, no. I'm not  that type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I want you to go to  whoever's sayin' that and  tell them to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron clears a piece of hair away from Donna's face and  puts it behind her ear. A pause He gently pushes her up a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her forehead. The camera follows as Aaron's lip make their way to Donna's. They kiss. Slowly at first, th deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Chris watch silently from the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette is siding on the ground, drawing with chalk on th side walk. Victor approaches her and sits down on the  stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda's not back yet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor runs his fingers through his hair. Jenette details her artwork. She focuses intently on her drawing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With her eyes lowered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Hector?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette stares at the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, then whadda ya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor stands up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna do somethin'  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette makes eye contact. Victor makes his way back over He sits  down beside her. Jenette's eyes focus back on her drawing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you know Amanda  from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' from around the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta girLfrLend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sees Chris kicking his football across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be my boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor doesn't respond. A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector's an asshole, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette looks at Victor. She catches him looking across t street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how ta get him back  if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette's eyes drop down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quietly begins to sob. She holds her face in her hand Fake tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You  alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron rounds the corner of the block with Donna. 3enette  catches a glimpse of him and starts sobbing loudly. Aaron sees Jenette crying on the ground. He leaves Donna behind and starts walking towards Jenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'? I'll do whatever you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron reaches them. Victor looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette cries. Aaron grabs Victor's arm tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Wha' happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette raises her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He hit you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sobs and nods "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron scoops her up onto his shoulder and grabs Victor by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette's chalk is left behind on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron marches them all up the block. Hector's silhouette  is visible in the distance as he cranks the pedal of an u bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette bounces and sobs over Aaron's shoulder as they tr up the block. Victor struggles to keep up as his sneakers begin to skid on the cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector sees the three of them approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his arm and points a finger at Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to go  home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron speeds up as he approaches Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit my sista?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette sobs in Aaron's arms as he puts her down.  Aaron releases Victor's sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smack! Aaron hits Hector in the face. Hector falls. Aaron turns and finds Victor turning away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Get over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor turns back towards the action. Holding Hector  against a wall, he pulls Victor near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hector)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to touch my  sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smack! Hector is pinned against the wall. He tries to fre himself of Aaron but he is no match. Chris watches from t curb, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector struggles. Aaron looks to Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenette turns her head to Victor. She wipes the tears fro her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor looks at Hector. A moment passes. Chris plays with his bat as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron punches Hector in the stomach. Hector doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris throws punches into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has dropped low in the sky. Long shadows rest on  The pavement after a steamy afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda's block is quiet and empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris strolls by Amanda's stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices Jenette's drawing, bends down on his knees and reads her sloppy writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "For entrance to secret passage press here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris presses his finger into the circle she's drawn. A  moment passes. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound is heard atop Amanda's stoop. Chris quickly walks away. Amanda appears through her front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down on her stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is sitting on the curb across the street tapping a empty bottle against the pavement. He sees Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor approaches Amanda's stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me, from the  pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. Yeah! Shorty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So watcha doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, umm, came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know somebody around  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  (He sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you do today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you know, cleaned the  house, cooked. Took care  of my little sisters. Sit  down. So where's Carlos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he's outside  someplace I don't like  takin' him down to certain  places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadja wanna see me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. I got a lot,  more than one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A play-ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No. Don't want none  either. Such bastards, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They play a girl, then you  complain, then they play  dumb, blah, blah, blah.  All that bullshit,  whatever I don't want  none. I'm gonna stay  single awhile, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wadda you do with your  girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, we make out and  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda doesn't believe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you think of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look good, that's it. So  what else do you do for  these girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I buy them flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you treat them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm faithful to  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda gets up and walks away. Victor quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda walks through the half-open fence and leans flat  against the wall. Victor stands close by, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps his distance from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I got you, you are so  scared. I don't believe  that you kissed no girls.  That you got three girls  and that you faithful and  this and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know I'm  standin' here and you say  I look good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kissed those girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't, you ain't  provin'it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I aint gotta prove nothin'  to no girl, 'cause I got  it like dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, 'cause you got it like  dat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor approaches Amanda. He touches her arm. Amanda  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Victor's hand and places it on her breast. Vict moves forward. Amanda moves his hand over her breasts. Sh wraps her arms around his waist. Victor bends his arms  around her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda hisses him on the lips, slowly. A long, deep kiss. As she kisses him she runs her hand through his hair. She pulls back. Victor looks around. Chris is at the entrance of the alleyway, watching them. He is holding his deflate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks at him for a second and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks down the block, his bat against the pavement.
